goal.ch:
(1) 課程將重點介紹岩石物理研究中使用的基本概念。
(2) 我每週提供一小時的岩石物理基本概念講座，旨在增強兩位兼職的博士級授課教師所提供的相關課程。這兩個課程: 呂明達，上學期 (井測與石油系統): 陳炳誠，(井測與新能源的應用),本學期。
(3) 這兩個相關的課程都與測井研究有關。 不過，我將更關注在岩石物理相關的背景知識與觀念的建立。
(4) 課程是根據獨立的主題組織的，但主題緊密相關。 我提供一系列講座來建構地球物理學和岩石物理學相關研究中所使用的基本概念。
(5) 更重要的是，該課程也將與我在同一學期提供的其他課程相關聯。 這些類別主題可以緊密的連結在一起。
(6) 可緊密耦合的相關課程類別是與地震波與地下材料特性和結構變化的相互作用與地震波傳遞有關。 課程名稱為：
震波傳播 I-岩石物理模型和數值模擬。
goal.en:
(1) Class will focus on the fundamental concepts used in rock physics studies.
(2) I offer a one-hour weekly lecture on basic concepts in rock physics designed to enhance relevant courses delivered by two doctoral lectures who are working in the industrial area with two related courses: Lu, M. D., last semester, Chen, B. C., this semester. 
(3) Both of these related courses are mainly focusing on the well-logging studies. However, I will pay more attention to the establishment of background knowledge and concepts related to rock physics.
(4) Class is organized under separated topic but tightly related subjects. I offer a sequence of lectures to build-up the fundamental concepts used in geophysics and rock physics related studies.
(5) More import, the class will also linked to the other class which I offer in the same semester. 
(6) The class subject can be tightly coupled together with seismic wave propagation class which emphasis on the seismic waves interacting with subsurface materials properties and/or structure changes. Class is entitled as: 
Wave Propagation I- Rock Physics Models and Numerical Simulation
Wave Propagation II- Theory

outline.ch:
(1)淺談阿爾奇公式(Archie formulation)的物理學原理
(2)阿爾奇參數a, b值的理論模型
(3)關於井測模型的問題
(4)複雜油氣水層於測井評價的若干問題
(5)常規測井資料計算砂岩儲層滲透率的理論思維
(6)關於用測井資料評估儲層濕潤性與相對滲透率
(7)泥質砂岩儲層注水開發水淹層飽和度理論模型
(8)關於自然電位
(9)關於孔隙直徑與粒度中值的意義
(10)指導研究的一些學習例子:根據缺失測井數據的震測資料來估計岩石物理參數
(11)基本的測井資料介紹或當前用 NMR 測井技術的前景
outline.en:
(1) A discussion on the physical principles and model used of Archie‘s formulation - I point out that Archie‘s formula is a theoretical formulation but not an empirical one as public mostly known.
(2) Theoretical model of Archie parameter a, b values
(3) Questions about well logging models
(4)Several issues in well logging evaluation of complex oil, gas and water layers
(5)Theoretical thinking on calculating permeability of sandstone reservoirs using conventional logging data
(6) About using well logging data to evaluate reservoir wettability and relative permeability
(7)Theoretical model of water flooded layer saturation in muddy sandstone reservoir water injection development
(8)About natural potential
(9)Regarding the meaning between pore diameter and particle size
(10)Some study examples which I guided my graduate student for estimating rock physics parameters from seismic data along under missing
(11)Introduction to basic well logging data or current prospects for using NMR logging technology

textbook.ch:
(1) Introduction to the physics of rocks, Yves Gueguen and Victor Palciauskas, Princeton University Press, Princeton, New Jersey, 1994
(2) The rock physics handbook, Gary Mavko, Tapan Mukerji, Jack Dvorkin, Cambridge University Press
(3) My own organization on fundamental issues on well logging and interpretations
